IIITA Model United Nations

Effervescence proudly presents to you all the 5th edition of IIIT Allahabad Model United Nations. Welcome to the official website of IIITA-MUN'23.

About IIITA MUN

IIITA Model United Nations was the first Model United Nations in the city of Allahabad. Started in 2014, it is an initiative which aims to establish a healthy debating environment for young minds budding with ideas regarding the current political affairs across the globe. Delegates will work with participants from all over the country in a highly competitive environment, in dissecting world affairs and creating policies in a conference of the highest quality. We hope to transform you from stu­dents into future leaders, all the while creating unforgettable memories.

To put it simply, Model UN is cos-play for people who find following current affairs equally interesting as a nerd would find his comics. However, MUN conferences differ from Comic Cons in that the delegates actually do use their superpowers of research, critical thinking, public speaking and teamwork to draft solutions to issues that have kept diplomats scratching their heads over the years. It is easy to dismiss MUNs as simply a simulation of the UN framework, but that would only tell the beginning of the story. (Not even the beginning, as modern day MUNs evolved from Model League of Nations, a simulation of the UN's failed predecessor.) With the joint creative forces of innumerable creative minds from high school and college students (and increasing numbers of people beyond) MUNs have evolved and diversified at unthinking proportions over the years. Today, any council - real or fictional, futuristic or historical - that seeks to resolve disputes by means of meaningful diplomacy can be found simulated at a Model UN conference. The Best Delegate and other mentions add a competitive flair to the collaborative environment and help bring out the unprecedented from the council.

FAQs

What is Model United Nations?

Model United Nations (MUN) is an academic simulation of the United Nations that aims to educate and encourage participants to discuss major issues concerning the world, topics in international relations, diplomacy and the United Nations agenda.

What are the dates of IIITA MUN?

IIITA MUN is a three day conference and will be held from 28th to 30th of December.

What will be the manner of conduction of the conference?

Conference will be held in IIIT, Allhabad campus.

Is previous experience required to apply as a delegate?

To apply as a delegate no previous experience is required.

What awards will be provided at IIITA-MUN this year?

The awards will be presented at the discretion of the chairs of each committee and will include one Best Delegate and two Verbal Mentions per committee.

Committees

CCC

The Continuous Crisis Committee, often referred to as CCC, plays a pivotal role in Model United Nations (MUN) simulations. This committee operates on the principle that crises can emerge at any moment, demanding swift and strategic responses from its delegates. The CCC is known for its dynamic nature, as it is not constrained by a fixed agenda or specific topic. Instead, participants are immersed in a real-time crisis scenario, which could range from political conflicts and international emergencies to intricate diplomatic negotiations. Delegates must stay alert, adapt to rapidly changing situations, and collaborate with fellow committee members to devise effective solutions. The Continuous Crisis Committee challenges MUN delegates to think critically, hone their diplomatic skills, and navigate the complexities of global politics in a dynamic and engaging manner.

Agenda :

Global COVID-19 Strategy: Addressing Unrest, Containment, and Economic Reopening.

Lok Sabha

Lok Sabha, India's lower house of Parliament, stands as a beacon of democratic representation. Comprising elected members, it plays a crucial role in shaping the nation's legislative framework. These members bring diverse perspectives to the table. Lok Sabha's deliberations and decisions are pivotal in addressing India's pressing issues and defining its political course. In the context of this MUN, understanding Lok Sabha's significance sheds light on the democratic principles that underpin India's governance and can offer valuable insights into the global discourse on representative institutions.

Agenda :

Deliberations on the Alignment of Civil and Personal Law Codes in India with respect to Sociocultural Dynamics.
